intro: Brossaea leucocarpa, commonly known as the white-fruited brossaea, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruits are small, round, and covered in a white, waxy coating, which gives it its common name. Brossaea leucocarpa is typically found in moist, sandy soils in open woodlands and along stream banks.
